item.title: RuneScape: Dragonwilds - How To Get Adhesive
item.description:
RuneScape: Dragonwilds is an open-world multiplayer survival game in which players need to hone their crafting, fighting, and collecting skills. The game has a lot of mysteries to uncover, Vaults to explore, enemies to fight, and items to unlock. The Adhesive in RuneScape: Dragonwilds is one of the many items players will need during their exploration and survival journey.

Crafting the Adhesive will help players transform Leather into Hard Leather to make better armor, items, and even weapons. To craft the Hard Leather, players need one Adhesive and two Leathers in RuneScape: Dragonwilds .

How To Craft Adhesive In RuneScape: Dragonwilds

To craft Adhesive in RuneScape: Dragonwilds , players need to collect Swamp Tar from Whispering Swamp. However, transforming the Swamp Tar into Adhesive requires using the Kiln.

Players can reach the Whispering Swamp during the Dragon Slayer Primary Quest in RuneScape: Dragonwilds , when the Old Wise Man sends players to investigate the blue-flame door. Upon reaching the Swamp, Swamp Tars will be scattered around the ground all around it, or players can obtain them when defeating enemies in Whispering Swamp at night.

How To Craft A Kiln In RuneScape: Dragonwilds

To craft a Kiln, players must have:

  • Ash Logs x8 : Ash Logs can be collected either by cutting down any Ash trees with a Stone Logging Axe or by picking them up from the ground.
  • Stones x20 : Stones can be collected from the ground or Stone Nodes.
  • Clay x6 : To obtain Clay, venture into the Whispering Swamps and use your Stone Pickaxe or the Roscksplosion Spell in RuneScape: Dragonwilds on Clay Nodes. The Spell will be automatically unlocked after reaching Mining Skill level 11.
  • Fire Runes x10 : Fire Runes are made by transforming Rune Essence at the Rune Altar

After collecting Clay, go back to your base and make sure to have all the required items to craft the Kiln. Use the Build menu and go to the Crafting section to locate the Kiln under the Processing tag. Select the item and find a suitable place around your base, but note that it can only be built in an open space . The rest of the requested materials can be obtained by doing the following:

Next, place the Swamp Tar inside the Kiln and watch it transform into Adhesive. However, to craft the Hard Leather, players must unlock the Tannerâ€™s Kit after collecting some Bronze Bars from Fractured Plains in RuneScape: Dragonwilds .

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A is at Risk of Losing Legends: Arceus' Best Feature
item.description:
With its modern-day setting, Pokemon Legends: Z-A could potentially risk losing a key mechanic its predecessor, Pokemon Legends: Arceus , introduced as part of the series' new approach to open-world gameplay. Despite expectations that a sequel to Legends: Arceus would be set in another region's past elsewhere in the Pokemon world, Pokemon Legends: Z-A instead opted to return to Gen 6's Kalos during the present day. However, this decision could have several implications for the upcoming game, especially for any features, abilities, and other integral mechanics that became necessary thanks to Legends: Arceus ' feudal backdrop.

One such feature was Legends: Arceus ' crafting mechanics, which were introduced as both a way for players to stock up on Poke Balls and an explanation behind the origins of Hisui's older, handcrafted Poke Balls. Due to their design and story implications, these Poke Balls played a key role in shaping Legends: Arceus ' marketing, gameplay, and Pokemon. But between Legends: Z-A single-city setting and the modern-day period, players may not need to craft their own Poke Balls, and ultimately, the game could scrap this core mechanic in favor of returning to Poke Centers and Marts, just like the other mainline games.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Might Drop Pokemon Legends: Arceus' Crafting

Though it hasn't been confirmed if players can craft balls or other items when exploring Lumiose City in Legends: Z-A , gameplay trailers have already featured the modern version of Poke Balls being used to catch and release Pokemon. While this would make sense given the game is set sometime after the events of Pokemon X and Y , especially when Kalos itself is home to the Poke Ball factory in Laverre City, it would suggest that Legends: Z-A will replace Legends: Arceus' features like crafting. Instead, it seems likely that Legends: Z-A could revert to buying in-game items just like most other present-day Pokemon games.

Despite being a key mechanic in Legends: Arceus , this was arguably only out of necessity; otherwise, players would have been forced to constantly return to Jubilife Village to replenish their Poke Balls whenever they ran out. Moreover, in the wake of other open-world games like Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , buying balls and items has proven to still be viable even with an open-world approach. But while Legends: Z-A might get by without Legends: Arceus ' crafting, it does potentially highlight a growing risk of future Pokemon Legends games losing the things that distinguish them from typical Pokemon games.

Pokemon Legends: Arceus' Crafting Benefited More Than Just Its Gameplay

Besides serving as an ancestor to modern Poke Balls, Legends: Arceus simultaneously reaffirmed the origins of Poke Balls as alluded to in games like Pokemon Gold and Silver , where balls were first made from carved Apricorns. Despite leading some to speculate Gold and Silver 's Johto would be the next Pokemon Legends ' region, the distinctive Hisui Poke Ball accommodated the game's historical backdrop, influenced its open-world gameplay, and helped generate intrigue around the game ahead of its launch. It even contributed to Legends: Arceus ' regional variants, expanding this same Poke Ball lore to introduce a dedicated Grass/Electric-type Pokemon line with Hisuian Voltorb and Electrode.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Risks Forgetting What Makes Pokemon Legends Unique

Without its distinguishing features like the Hisuian Poke Ball, Legends: Z-A is at risk of losing sight of what made the premise of Pokemon Legends games interesting. While neither Legend: Arceus nor Legends: Z-A are considered spin-offs, their contrast to Pokemon 's ever-increasing generation of games sets them apart, like being set in an older region or at a different time. Should Legends: Z-A scrap crafting and lead to future Pokemon Legends games set close to the present day, then this subseries could start to lose its best features like new Poke Balls, regional variants, and more as they become more like every other Pokemon game.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: What is Zoh Shia? - Bite-Size Lore
item.description: When completing the Low Rank questline of Monster Hunter Wilds, the hunter is challenged by the culmination of Ancient Wyveriaâ€™s guardians. This titanic dragon showcases some of the strongest attacks and most intimidating stature in the entire game, and in Title Update 1 has become a repeatable fight. Zoh Shia is the ultimate challenge for the hunter who has fought past everything the forbidden lands has to offer.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: Best Giant Barbarian Build
item.description:
The Giant subclass for Barbarians in Baldur's Gate 3 lets players tower over almost everything in sight while empowering Thrown weapons one way or another. This subclass is perfect for those who just want to chuck things at people, whether it's bladese, objects, or other people.

The following guide covers some general knowledge about how to build a Giant Barbarian, as well as some recommendations for early and late-game gear options. Its playstyle isn't totally different from a Berserker Barbarian, but once a Giant unlocks all of their abilities, they become extremely scary to fight against.

BG3 Giant Barbarian Build - Character Creation

You won't get access to the Giant subclass until you reach level 3, but it's good to prepare your character before you even begin the game. The following are our recommendations on what makes a good foundation for a Giant Barbarian in BG3 .

Giant Barbarian Character Creation Preferences

Race

Half-Orc or Dwarf

Background

Soldier

Preferred Stats

Strength

Dexterity or Wisdom

Race

Half-Orcs and Dwarves are arguably the best races for Barbarians (and melee fighters in general) thanks to their racial traits . Half-Orcs have Relentless Endurance, which will prevent them from falling after reaching 0 HP once every Long Rest. Meanwhile, Dwarves have Dwarven Toughness, which further increases their max HP every time they level up.

You can't go wrong with any race when building a character, but if you want to be able to shrug off hits and death itself, then these two are your best bets.

Background

Soldier is the preferred background for Giant Barbarians mainly due to the Proficiency bonuses it provides for Athletics and Intimidation checks . Giant Barbarians rely a lot on Athletics to hit their skills, and since they'll be naturally intimidating, getting the Intimidation bonus is a no-brainer.

Outlander is also a decent alternative. Apart from the Athletics bonus it provides, it also improves your Wisdom (Survival) Ability Checks. The latter could come in handy, especially if you're not planning on intimidating people much.

Stats

Strength is a given for Barbarians. The real concern here is the secondary stat. We recommend either Dexterity or Wisdom for the following reasons:

  • Dexterity will improve your Armor Class, which is very useful for Barbarians who wear either light or no armor at all.
  • Wisdom will improve your Wisdom Saving Throws. Many enemies in the late-game use Wisdom-based attacks and spells. Boosting your Wisdom will protect you from them.

Whether your level up Dexterity or Wisdom is up to you. There will always be other ways to improve these stats later on as you level up and collect gear.

Feats

Upon reaching levels 4, 8, and 12, you'll gain Feat points, which you can use to unlock some powerful passive effects. For Giant Barbarian, we recommend choosing any of the following :

  • Tavern Brawler: Increase either Strength or Constitution by 1, to a max of 20. When you throw something, add your Strength modifier twice to both Attack and Damage rolls.
  • Alert: You can't be surprised, and you gain a +5 Initiative bonus.
  • Ability Improvement: Add 1 to any stat you choose.
  • Sentinel: Defensive feat that buffs Opportunity Attacks.

Multiclass Options

There are tons of good multiclass builds for Baldur's Gate 3 , and as far as GIant Barbarian is concerned, your best choice is going to be Fighter. Action Surge is too good of a skill to pass up since it lets you attack more times, and by picking Fighter, you get to use the Great Weapon Fighting Style, which will let you reroll attacks with two-handed weapons if it rolls a 1 or 2.

Best Equipment for Giant Barbarians in BG3

The Giant Barbarian subclass is all about throwing things, and that includes weapons, items, furniture, and even your enemies themselves. With that in mind, you'll want to get the best throwing weapons in BG3 early on, and once you reach Act 3 and get all of your important skills, you can move on to using legendary weapons.

Important Early Game Gear

Weapon

Returning Pike

Armor

Gloves of Uninhibited Kushigo

Trinkets

Ring of Flinging

These three are your bread-and-butter items. Returning Pike is great since, as its name suggests, it returns when thrown . Use this until you get Elemental Cleaver at Level 6 â€” this ability imbues your weapon with an element of your choice while also giving them the Thrown property , making any weapon return to your hand after being thrown.

Gloves of Uninhibited Kushigo and Ring of Flinging both improve the damage you deal with thrown weapons. You can get the former by saving Baelen in the Underdark, while the latter can be bought from Arron in Emerald Grove.

Late Game Gear

Weapon

Balduran's Giantslayer

Armor

Mask of Soul Perception

Bonespike Garb

Bonespike Boots

Bracers of Defence

Trinkets

Ring of Protection

Ring of Flinging

Amulet of the Harpers

Amulet of Greater Health

Fey Semblance Amulet

Balduran's Giantslayer is an amazing two-handed weapon. With Giant Barbarian, you can throw this thing and have it return to you afterward thanks to Elemental Cleaver. Plus, Giant Form stacks with Giant's Rage stacking the effects of both while also making you extra large.

For the rest of our gear, we'll be focusing on defense . Parts of the Bonespike Garb and Boots contradict the previous sentence, but since they count as Clothing, players will get all the bonuses related to effects that require you to not have armor on (such as Bracers of Defence's AC bonus).

As for accessories, Giant Barbarian has a ton of options thanks to Elemental Cleaver . Basically, since you'll be able to deal elemental damage with your attacks, rings like Snowburst Ring and Ring of Spiteful Thunder gain more value. Use what you prefer.
